Post_Trial_Scene: ^I can’t believe it, Anna, you really did it…
^I’ve been so hopeless for the last few days, thinking my entire life and career was over…
^But what you did was truly a miracle.
^You did great, Boss! All the times you were telling Arthur Splanoir off was so badass!
^If I ever get in a tacky case like this, I’m SO coming to you to represent me.
^But it’d probably be way easier than today, because I’m not a celebrity…
^and I won’t have Arthur Splanoir tailing me.
^I’m glad things turned out this way.
^I couldn’t have done it without all of your guys’ help.
^Ms. Kanna may have been found innocent, but the case isn’t over.
^I’ve agreed to represent Eileen Lore on her plea for self-defense.
^The trial will probably be in a few weeks… or days, if I’m unlucky.
^It seems like cases keep flying at you nonstop…
^but you just tackled a HUGE one!
^Hey — if you guys are free, let’s go get Korean barbecue and hit karaoke!
^I’d be more than down! That sounds like a great way to end such a stressful day.
^I’m *not* going easy on you for karaoke.
^Nadine agreed — so you guys HAVE to come now!
^Maybe we’ll even sing one of her songs!
^I’d like to see you sing them.
^Hey, do you doubt me or something?
^What’s that one called again — the one that goes:
^Those two seem to get along really well.
^And for once… I agree with Diego.
^I know you told Eileen you’re willing to represent her,
^but you have plenty of time to prepare.
^You need to take some time off and reward yourself.
^I don’t say I’m proud of you for no reason.
^As the head of the crime lab, I’ve got a lot of responsibilities.
^The lab is always busy, and I’ve already used a lot of time attending this trial.
^maybe for you, I can make an exception.
^It’s been a while since we’ve even gone out.
^Okay! Me and Nadine just booked the reservation for dinner and karaoke!
